section.title: Overview and introduction
section.p: One of the goals of the giellatekno-project is to provide easy access to the text materials for non-commercial purposes such as research. The text materials will be available through a query processing tool: a tool with which a user can fetch different types of data from the Sámi corpora. The raw corpus material is collected in co-operation with the owners of the documents. The documents are preprocessed so that the texts can be used in research. The process of text collection is described in documents corpus_conversion.html and corpus_conversion_tech.html. This documents describes the process where the document is transferred to the graphical corpus interface. The graphical corpus interface is developed and maintaned byTextlaboratorietin the university of Oslo.

section.title: How to parallelize documents
section.p: Files that are ready to be parellellised exist in $GTFREE/prestable/converted. The steps to parallelize between sme and nob are:

ol.li:
Compile the tools needed for further refinement of the input files:
cd $GTHOME/gt
make GTLANG=sme
make GTLANG=sme abbr
cd $GTHOME/st/nob/src
make

Make an anchor file using the command (note that different text domains may have different additional anchor files):
generate-anchor-list.pl --lang1=sme --lang2=nob --outdir=$GTFREE $GTHOME/gt/common/src/anchor.txt $GTHOME/gt/common/src/anchor_admin.txt

Compile TCA2, the sentence aligner, using these commands:
cd $GTHOME/tools/alignment-tools/tca2
ant

section.p: The files may be parallellised in commandline mode.
The files may also be parallellised in graphical mode.

ol.li:
To load files when starting tca2 in gui mode, issue this command:
java -jar $GTHOME/tools/alignment-tools/tca2/dist/lib/alignment.jar -anchor=<anchorfilename> -in1=<thefirstfileofapairtoalign> -in2=<thesecondfileofapairtoalign>

section.p: To parallelize the other way, exchange the values for lang1 and lang2 in step 2 and 4, and change the find command in step 4 to find $GTFREE/prestable/converted/nob

section.title: The files and formats
section.p: The project-internal corpus format contains the basic elements, such as paragraphs, lists and tables that can be extracted from the original document format. The xml-format of the Saami corpus resources is documented in corpus_conversion.html

The original name of the document is preserved in the process with the suffix indicating the document type, e.g. file.doc. When the text is extracted from the original document and moved to xml-structure the file gets the extension .xml. So the resulting file is file.doc.xml. This file is used as a basis for analysis. The analyzed corpus text is by default stored to a file file.doc.analyzed.xml. There is one intermediate format which is used for alignment of the parallel texts, those files are indicated with suffix .sent.xml, e.g. file.doc.sent.xml.
The xml-files reside in either $GTFREE/converted or $GTBOUND/converted

section.title: Aligning documents
section.p: The documents are aligned using TRANSLATION CORPUS ALIGNER (TCA) 2by Knut Hofland and Øystein Reigem, slightly modified by us so to easily use it from the command line.
The program gets as input the files that contain numbered s-elements:file.doc.sent.xml and file_n.doc.sent.xml.
The program outputs three files:

ul.li: one file that contains the pairings of the sentence-id's. The file name is generally file.doc.sent.xml_file_n.doc.sent.xml.xml which indicates the order of the paired id lists.
a file pair where each line corresponds to the parellellised content in the other file. These files are named file.doc.sent_new.txt and file_n.doc.sent_new.txt

section.title: Morphological information
section.p: The file korpustags.txt contains the list of tags and their internal distrbution. The list below list is not up-to-date, please see the file korpustags.txt in cvs.

section.title: Corpus tags
section.p: There are the following tag categories:

ul.li: Part of speech: N A V Adv Pron CS CC Adp Po Pr Interj Pcle Num
Number or Person/Number: Sg Pl Sg1 Sg2 Sg3 Du1 Du2 Du3 Pl1 Pl2 Pl3 ConNeg
Case: Ess Nom Gen Acc Ill Loc Com
Possessive suffix: PxSg1 PxSg2 PxSg3 PxDu1 PxDu2 PxDu3 PxPl1 PxPl2 PxPl3
Derivation (We must consider whether to use these..): Pass h upmi ...
Mood: Ind Pot Cond Imprt ImprtII
Nominal verb form: Inf Act PrsPrc PrfPrc VGen VAbess Ger ConNeg ConNegII
Pronoun type: Pers Dem Interr Refl Recipr Rel Indef
